- Derfflinger: No hits in either.
- Seydlitz: No hits in either.
- König: Yes, with 7 in 1400lb and 1 in 1250lb.
- Markgraf: 1 hit in 1250lb.

Wait a minute, so the claim says König is the only ship hit by 13.5-inch rounds. But looking at Lützow, it has 2 hits under 1250lb. That means Lützow was also hit with 13.5-inch rounds. So König isn't the only one; Lützow was too. That would make the first part of the claim false.

But wait, maybe I'm misunderstanding the numbers. Are these counts of shells fired or hits? The table seems to be about how many times each ship was hit by different types of shells. So, if that's the case, then both Lützow and König were hit with 13.5-inch rounds.

Therefore, the claim that König is the only ship hit with 13.5-inch rounds is incorrect because Lützow also had hits in that category. Additionally, the number of hits on König was 8 (7 +1), not just 7 as the claim states.

So both parts of the claim are false: König isn't the only one, and it wasn't hit with exactly 7 rounds but 8.
</think>

The claim is incorrect because König isn't the sole ship hit by 13.5-inch rounds (Lützow was also hit) and it received a total of 8 hits, not 7.
